sentence.Network_en: He had the temerity to call me a liar!
He had the temerity to call me a liar.
He had the temerity to ask for higher wages after only a day's work.
sentence.Network_cn: 只工作了一天,他就蛮不讲理地要求增加工资.

stouthearted adj. 大胆的，刚毅的temerity n. 大胆，鲁莽valiant adj. 勇敢的，英勇的

list.abs: It was amazing that she should exhibit such temerity , but he would teach her !, 她竟然表现得如此放肆 , 真是惊人 , 但他要教训她!
He had the temerity to call me a liar ., 他竟胆敢说我撒谎.
He had the temerity to suggest I resign ., 他胆敢提议我辞职.
He had the temerity to call me a liar ., 他竟胆敢说我撒谎.
He had the temerity to suggest I resign ., 他胆敢提议我辞职.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin temeritas, from temere 'rashly'

entry.def: If you say that a person has the temerity to do something, you are annoyed about something they have done which you think showed a lack of respect.

example.ex: He has even had the temerity to invoke the names of Martin Luther King Jr and Malcolm X in defence of his actions.
example.tran: 他竟然敢搬出马丁·路德·金和马尔科姆·艾克斯的名字来为自己的行为辩解。

example.ex: ...'difficult' patients who have the temerity to challenge their doctors' decisions.
example.tran: 胆敢不遵医嘱的“难缠”病人
